item.title: LRB 路 Andrew O'Hagan 路 The Satoshi Affair
item.description:
LRB 路 Andrew O'Hagan 路 The Satoshi Affair

The Raid Ten men raided a house in Gordon, a north shore suburb of Sydney, at 1.30 p.m. on Wednesday, 9 December 2015. Some of the federal agents wore shirts that said 'Computer Forensics'; one carried a search warrant issued under the Australian Crimes Act 1914. They were looking for .

item.title: Simple Contracts are Better Contracts: What We Can Learn from the Meltdown of The DAO - Blockstack Blog
item.description:
Simple Contracts are Better Contracts: What We Can Learn from the Meltdown of The DAO - Blockstack Blog

50 million were "stolen" from a project called "The DAO" and now the Ethereum community is deciding how to move forward and recover from the disaster. But each crisis presents a learning opportunity, so let's take a deeper dive into the matter and see how we can do better.

item.title: Cashless economics: The new wave of mobile money
item.description:
Cashless economics: The new wave of mobile money

This past March, the IGC and the Bank of Sierra Leone co-hosted the Sub-regional workshop on Mobile Money in West Africa, the first major regional policy event to be held in Sierra Leone since it was declared free of Ebola in January 2016.

item.title: GOV.UK Verify
item.description:
GOV.UK Verify

GOV.UK Verify is the new way to prove who you are online. It gives safer, simpler and faster access to government services like filing your tax or checking the information on your driving licence. It takes about 10 minutes to verify your identity the first time you use GOV.UK Verify, and a couple of minutes any time after that.

item.title: Cryptography, Blockchain, and International Arbitration: How Fintech Revolution Influences Jurisprudence
item.description:
Cryptography, Blockchain, and International Arbitration: How Fintech Revolution Influences Jurisprudence

Over the course of the last year, blockchain has become a buzzword not only for startuppers, banks, and technology companies, but also for public entities. It draws more and more attention from lawyers, both as a part of discussions on digital currency's legal status, and in the search of the technology's applications in legal operations.

item.title: MacroMania
item.description:
MacroMania

As I'll be at Consensus 2016 event speaking in a session on "Digital Cash for Central Banks" (agenda available here), I thought this might be a good time to gather my thoughts on what central bankers should be thinking about as a new wave of financial innovation comes crashing on our shore.

item.description:
Social Policy Bonds

Social Policy Bonds: Policy as if outcomes mattered

item.title: UBS Donates Blockchain Code to HIV Research
item.description:
UBS Donates Blockchain Code to HIV Research

UBS has donated the code for its experimental trading platform powered by blockchain technology to an organisation that wants to issue bonds to raise money for HIV research. Financial News reports. Finclusion, a London-based fintech firm, has developed a blockchain platform for HEAL Alliance, a non-profit organisation looking into a cure for HIV that wants to issue social impact bonds.
